abstract: Shareholders liked Warren Buffett’s stock buyback decision, but what’s good for Mr. Buffett might not be so good for other corporate bosses.
snippet: Shareholders liked Warren Buffett’s stock buyback decision, but what’s good for Mr. Buffett might not be so good for other corporate bosses.
lead_paragraph: Warren Buffett isn’t too old to try something new. His Berkshire Hathaway conglomerate said on Monday that it might buy back an unlimited amount of both classes of shares, at up to a 10 percent premium over book value. Many investors like to copy what Mr. Buffett does, but stock repurchases are best left to the Oracle of Omaha. If shares of other companies were truly undervalued, Berkshire probably wouldn’t be buying its own.

byline.original: By Agnes T. Crane, Robert Cyran and Reynolds Holding
